page.title: 05Farming in Onecote Jan-June
page.content:
In January and February it is the lambing season and it is often difficult for the milk tanker to get through the snow.
In March, lambing is coming to an end and the farmers are carting and spreading muck to fertilize the fields. The cows are let out during the day but are brought in at night.
By April muck spreading has stopped and the cows are let out at all times.
In May and June silageing is taking place. This involves mowing the grass, leaving it to dry for a day, then chopping it and putting it into a shed to be used for winter feed.
